website_summaries.verdict: You wouldn'tt want to take these on a hike, but they work great on snowy or icy sidewalks and roads.
pros: Great traction on ice, black ice, and snow
Rolls into a small, lightweight ball for storage (and won't cut bags or pockets)
Good for city and town walking
cons: Don't wear them inside or on dry pavement, as the coils can turn slippery and break easily

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day
customer_reviews.text: These broke the first day. The rubber tore and they just fell apart. I wasn't going to carry them for the rest of my backpacking trip so I picked the pieces off of the trail and threw them out. Now I can't even return them. They might work for walking to the mailbox but if they brush up against a rock or 2 it is all over
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: 3 of 3 pairs BROKE on FIRST hike
customer_reviews.text: Totally mislead by all the positive reviews. We ordered 3 pairs and went on a moderate 8 mile hike. All pairs broke during this first hike. DO NOT BUY. Spend a bit more money and get the microspikes instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Broke 1st Day
customer_reviews.text: One cleat broke within 30 mins on first day clearing icy driveway. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Mountford

customer_reviews.title: Survived the Portland Oregon Blizzards...
customer_reviews.text: I used these bad boys after it snowed a whopping 2 inches in Portland, Oregon the other day. I was running around Portland like Usain Bolt. I didn't slip a bit. Best < $20 purchase ever. Even if they break after one season, I'll get another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Mjsielerjr

customer_reviews.title: Love my Yaktrax
customer_reviews.text: Just received my Yaktrax and returned from walking my dog. Am in love with them! We are having a brutal winter in ND with so much snow, ice, etc. I now feel safe when I head out for a walk and don't feel like I am taking a chance on falling. The Yaktrax stretch on easily and quickly, fitting all my different pairs of boots, and grip the ice and snow so nicely. I wear a size 9 1/2 shoe and ordered the medium. So happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: MJF

customer_reviews.title: Great on the snow - dangerous on paths that have been cleared of snow, so difficult to use in the city
customer_reviews.text: Great for walking in the snow/ice, but as soon as you walk on a non-ice surface (on the street or in a building) - watch out! You'll slip around like crazy. I got them for a snow festival for myself and my mother, but we didn't feel safe wearing them on the street and stepping off the snow into a footpath that had been cleared of snow. Especially for an older person, they became very unstable and scary. So, if I use this again I'll have to be prepared to take them on and off to switch between surfaces, which is not easy to do often.
customer_reviews.author: CG

customer_reviews.title: These are  the greatest bit of safety equipment on the planet.
customer_reviews.text: I would happily give these a 5 star review, but - after just a couple of weeks of not very heavy use one of them broke. I can still use it, and I don't expect them to last forever, but hey - give me a full winter and I'll be happy. That said, any grown adult who doesn't wear these in snowy or icy conditions is nuts. They don't cost much, they go on and off in a few seconds. If they save one fall that's a potential busted hip or worse. These are the greatest bit of safety equipment on the planet.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Schaffer

customer_reviews.title: Should've gotten a smaller size.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a medium based on reviews that I read, but I normally wear a Women's size 8. These are fine for my boots, but are too big for my regular shoes. I have since ordered a size small which fits great.
customer_reviews.author: Arlette

customer_reviews.title: A feeling of Safety
customer_reviews.text: Feels very secure when walking outside on ice and snow, however beware when you enter a building because you can skid across the floor very easily.
customer_reviews.author: Craigaleo

customer_reviews.title: Great for when I first moved to MI.
customer_reviews.text: These are very popular in my area with people who are either new to icy sidewalks (I moved here from the desert) or have knee/leg/foot conditions. They were recommended to me by my Latin tutor my freshman year. She'd never needed them in South Dakota, but the ice was managed differently around the college and she asked her advisor about them after she noticed all the unusual footprints. Great for when you're on crutches or a cane, need a brace, or just haven't learned how to walk on slick sidewalks yet. I still have them in the back of the closet for just-in-case situations, and I've loaned them out a few different times over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: great for city or packed snow
customer_reviews.text: These are eminently portable (they pack very small, are lightweight and don't have sharp edges to cut your bags) and are also great at walking around on sidewalks with ice or packed snow. They're very easy to put on as well. Where the round springs started to show their limits is solid ice on any sloped surface. I would not want to walk on a glacier or other sloped hard ice on these. There, I found this to work much better (edit: changed from 4 to 5 stars because they are very good at what they're being sold for - safer walking in city)
customer_reviews.author: Laurentiu Badea

customer_reviews.title: They actually still work but I figured it I would just get a new pair since I think it is only going to get worse. They work perfectly though
customer_reviews.text: Bought my first pair in Feb. 2017 and had to buy a 2nd pair in Feb. 2018 after the first pair' toe portion became worn down and broke (see attached photo). The other half of the pair shows the same wear and tear. They actually still work but I figured it I would just get a new pair since I think it is only going to get worse. They work perfectly though, I have not had any issues walking on snow/ice with them and wear them everyday to work when conditions warrant them. Just wish they would last longer.
customer_reviews.author: CM1983

customer_reviews.title: Yaktrax to buy
customer_reviews.text: Live in North Dakota where it is cold and wintry for almost 6-7 months out of the year so these are VERY easy to put on and use. I feel comfortable wearing and using them. Would VERY much recommend buying and using them as they help you walk on ice, snow, and sleet!!!! GREAT product!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rese7

customer_reviews.title: Great tracks...when they are on
customer_reviews.text: I must say that these tracks are excellent for keeping your footing on ice and snow. The week before I got them, I slipped and fell HARD walking the dog, about five times in total, including three times in two days. I haven't slipped and fallen since then. They do, however, have a tendency to come off. I can't tell you how many times this has happened and I've only had them for a few weeks. I don't necessarily notice right away that they're gone, and keep having to backtrack through the snow to find them. That's very annoying obviously.
customer_reviews.author: Meaghan

customer_reviews.title: 72 Hour Product
customer_reviews.text: Product worked great for 72 hours then the straps began breaking. Bought the correct size for my husband who wears a size 7.5 boot. As I am handicapped and walking is difficult for me I was planning to purchase two more pairs after the first day - now - is it worth all of the hassle to repackage and pay shipping on an item that may or may not be replaced. Purchased from Amazon believing it would be a better product.. Extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanne

customer_reviews.title: These are absolute life savers!!
customer_reviews.text: Alaska winter/autumn tried and tested! Best best thing to have in the snow! It’s light, folds and stores easy, fits in pockets and saves you from slipping even in the slickest ice. I’m so glad we bought this before going to Alaska. They really are convenient to have and they’re easy to put on and off. I definitely recommend these to anyone going in deep snow or slippery ice. Amazing stuff!
customer_reviews.author: MJLV

customer_reviews.title: Gsives me stability on ice.
customer_reviews.text: I put theses cleats on a pair of sneakers I walk with and have dedicated this pair to only be worn with the Yaktrax. I have crossed several ice areas on my walks and I feel very comfortable with these cleats. I don't know about longevity but so far I really like them. The pair I have has what looks like springs that provide traction so I don't know about losing pieces on my walk. They were not real difficult to put on, but with a little effort they stretched out to cover my soles completely. I appreciated the fact that they were tight when installed. Will update after more use.
customer_reviews.author: George from Colorado

customer_reviews.title: Good on snow and ice but short life
customer_reviews.text: While this product lasts its great. It makes walking on snowy and icy sidewalks easy and as stable as if there was no snow or ice on the sidewalk. The problem is that it has a short life. Only about 6 uses and the metal wire on the bottom that is the grip had already cut through the band of rubber it encircles which keeps the wire in place and on your shoe. Once this happens it's broken and you can't use it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: hnaz

customer_reviews.title: Yaktrax Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because my daughter has a pair & raves about them. I used mine for the first time after we had a heavy snowfall followed by sleet and dropping temperatures. The streets were a sheet of ice and I had to walk the dog. The Yaktrax were perfect for those conditions. They gave me perfect stability. Usually I grab & grasp every nearby object and dread falling down. For the first time, I felt safe on such a slippery surface. I recommend these for anyone who lives in a snowy climate.
customer_reviews.author: Emma M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for walking the dog on icy conditions
customer_reviews.text: I ordered medium to fit over my boots size 8.5 women. They came on time for the freezing rain the hit us this winter. They worked great on the rough ice that form on sidewalks and streets. Later on when the ice became thin and smooth I slipped a bit, but still not bad enough to fall down. They have been in my boots while walking and even when to the grocery store with them, that waking on the tile was more of a challenge. Overall I am happy to have them on my boots while taking the dog out and walking around the neighborhood.
customer_reviews.author: S. Ayriss

customer_reviews.title: A little hard to install, but work really well
customer_reviews.text: I inherited an old pair of these a long time ago, and I found that they work so well that I eventually purchased this new pair. On the downside, it takes some muscle power to install these over my boots. Also, the older pair that I had showed a lot of red rust on the spiral metal grips, I presume from me using them while salting my driveway. On the good side, they function extremely well when walking on ice. I can walk on my highly sloped driveway with ease during the winter, even if it is coated in ice. This makes shoveling and salting the driveway much safer.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: I got these to be able to walk down a very big icy hill at the dog park. I was skeptical if these would work, but after reading the reviews I thought I would try them. I'm glad I did. I normally wear a 3.5 in kids so I have a really hard time finding things that fit. These work great on my shoes and do not fit loose at all. They go on really snug so I don't worry about losing them while walking. I would highly recommend these if you don't want to fall while walking on ice outside. I'm very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: bookwormTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Great product - consider size
customer_reviews.text: I sprained my knee in 2007 when I slipped on black ice. I got yaktrax at that time and have used them on slippery surfaces ever since. They work great, and I will not be without them. Be careful on indoor non carpeted flooring, because they do not give traction there. The other thing to consider is the size. I recommend that if your shoe size is at the upper end of the size range, try the next size. I have arthritis in my hands, and this works well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Yeah, much better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: I take these everywhere there is ice. I no longer slip and can jump and dance on ice. They are very snug and fit over all of my shoes and boots. Even my converse. I never leave home without them now and they have saved my wrists plenty of times! Wish I knew about these sooner. I've had mine for two years and they still look new. Took them sledding and they came off real easy multiple times, however they were not hard to find at all and I recovered them instantly. Definitely get these, they fold up and you can stuff em in a bag or in a shoe.
customer_reviews.author: z4pper

customer_reviews.title: Good for light duty
customer_reviews.text: These have great traction but have a few issues for real use. If yo walk in crusty or deep snow it will quickly rip them off your boot and you may lose them if you are not paying attention or have a retainer strap. When walking on hard snow or ice over time the springs screw themselves into sort of compressed knots. The traction is still good but it feels funny to walk on. Further, the rubber bands at the heel don't last very long with daily use. One of mine failed and snapped in less than a month.
customer_reviews.author: Cosmic11do2

customer_reviews.title: These things saved me last winter, so I bought ...
customer_reviews.text: These things saved me last winter, so I bought an additional pair for this year. I literally carry these in my purse because the weather can be so unpredictable where I live, I never know when we will get a freezing rain storm. They stretch right onto the shoe and hold incredibly well. I climbed up and down a very steep 1/4 mile hill that was snowed/ iced over for 2 weeks back and forth to work last winter wearing these, with no falls. These are a must for winter for me.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: So Far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. It fits my size 12 boots. It held up well on the on the icey side walks. So yeah, I'm happy with them so far.
customer_reviews.author: DJAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Not as safe as you think
customer_reviews.text: Two stars because they fit well. Take off three stars because: A) If you're on anything other than pavement, they pick up lots of debris. B) The ease in putting them on comes at a price: they fall off fairly easily. C) They slip and slide on ice far more easily than other grips/cleats. If you can find a dealer in "Wintertrax" (universal fit), they are a better choice (i.e. more secure footing). Better yet are the pro level cleats.
customer_reviews.author: Boswell

customer_reviews.title: The Original Icey Sidewalk Slide Preventer
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two sets of these a long time ago and they are still in use. I purchased two more sets of these to keep in my cars in case they weather gets icey. Much less expensive than other similar products they are still the best product in my opinion and they last a long time for me since in the center of Ohio, they only get used a few times each year. Very affordable insurance to avoid a debililtating slip and fall and the older you get, the more you will appreciate them.
customer_reviews.author: Army Vet

customer_reviews.title: Simple to put on; okay for most carpet
customer_reviews.text: I've only used this a couple of times so far, but they've been pretty good. They're easy to slip on my shoes. I've used them with my regular sneakers, but they also worked great with my wing-tips (and helped me not fall on my butt while carrying a casket during a funeral in a snow storm.) Would recommend. These won't destroy the carpeting or durable wooden flooring if you need to briefly walk on these surfaces, but probably wouldn't wear them regularly on them, or on surfaces that are more likely to be damaged. After using them, no regrets on the choosing these.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: UPDATE
customer_reviews.text: ugh...I LOVED these until they broke less than a month in. I did have trouble from the beginning with the "spring-like" wires coming uncoiled, but I overlooked that minor inconvenience by twisting them back into place, however, this weekend one of the rubber threads right under the toe hold snapped. Regrettably, they're now in the trash bin. RATS! I was completely sold on them. Here's my original review: I walk the dog in Minnesota's endless winters. I am SO sorry that I didn't follow my friends' advice and try these earlier! They are wonderful. The sizing recommendation was perfect! Don't second guess. These have convinced a skeptic.
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: Staying upright in Vermont
customer_reviews.text: I live at the North Pole, though the map calls it Vermont. Snow and ice everywhere, and nothing in this frozen tundra of a state is flat. I’ve used these for a number of years now. I have a set on a pair of boots and bought another set for a pair of slip on shoes for when the snow isn’t deep. I find them hard to take on and off so I just have dedicated pairs of boots/shoes and leave them on. I’m in and out all the time with the dogs who have no judgment and think this snow and ice is great. Very sure footed with them no matter how icy it gets.
customer_reviews.author: Nonabelle

customer_reviews.title: not for kids!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my daughter, but it broke after 5 minutes of use so I'm returning it. the Pro model wasn't available in kids sizes -- but kids need the strap over the toes (and another around the heels). don't get this for kids! argh, I was really disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Lars R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Fits well
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 9 shoe which was the low end on the size cleats I bought. They fit on well and I they work well. I see some people have a problem with them breaking. I wonder if their shoes / boots were on the high end of size chart for the cleats they bought. Fitting the cleats I bought on shoes or boots a couple of sizes larger would require a good deal of stretching. Just a thought, but perhaps stretching them so tightly may have contributed to having them break. Maybe a larger size might provide a longer life. It seems like common sense to me.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Beard

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to use this winter. After his knee replacement surgery (both knees) didn't want him slipping around on the ice. They are tough and the studs do dig in. The only problem we had is that they kept coming off his shoes/boots. So I'd find one of them randomly laying in the snow. This is a terrific idea, but I wonder if a strap over the top of the shoe/boot might help hold them on better.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: works great, doesn't damage floors... but rubber doesn't last long
customer_reviews.text: PRO: works great, doesn't damage floors (ie. they are not spikey (like stabilicers and icetrekkers) - in case you need to move indoors occasionally) CON1: not quite as much traction as stablicers & icetrekkers CON2: rubber breaks over time (i've had 2 pairs, on my 3rd) - mainly sticking with these because i occasionally have to walk on floors that are sensitive to other grippers (stablicers, icetrekkers) TIP: i have an sz9 boot... go up in size... i think the sizings work if used on sneakers, but if you're using them on hiking boots, go up a size.
customer_reviews.author: L. Caballes

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for any surface that ices up.
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Yak Trax were a gift from my elderly mother and I initially wore them to please her, but quickly learned that once again Mother knows best. Our driveway has a decent decline that I've slid down several times, unintentionally. Yak Trax's allow me to shovel the driveway without being afraid of falling after sliding. I've not have a pair of Yak Trax last more than one winter as the springs across the bottom always snap, but this is my fourth pair and I don't regret having to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Hart

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and stable, just like a yak...
customer_reviews.text: I'm a klutz. I fall. I'm not graceful and I have a fear of falling and breaking my leg in a hideous manner on the ice. Heck, I fear falling down in the shower and suffering a compound fracture of epic proportions. Too bad I can't wear my Yak Trax in the shower, because these bad boys grip like crazy. I couldn't even tell it was slippery out when I put these on my boots and went to start my car. It's easy to make a normal stride in these and they don't feel like you're wearing a cleat. Highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: DreadPirateRoberts

customer_reviews.title: A Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: We've had several pairs of these over the years, and they've all had the same problems. (1) They fall off your shoe or boot if you walk in snow that is over two inches deep. The snow pulls them off. So, they are easy to lose when you are out for a walk in the winter. (2) They do not grip on hard, smooth ice. (3) They don't last. The rubber often breaks and so does the coiled steel cleat. If they were priced at about $5.00 they would be worth it. Lose one or it breaks, no big deal. But at $20 a pair--waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Lapu-Lapu

customer_reviews.title: Very good product.
customer_reviews.text: I've used Yaktrax walkers for many winters. They will help prevent you from slipping. When I first bought them, some of my friends laughed when they saw me using them. I told them, if you fall and break or fracture a bone you won't be laughing. Next season 3 friends asked me where to buy them. More useful in snow than ice. The advantages of Yaktrax is that they won't ruin a carpet or wood floor as some of the other products have sharp cleats and thus cannot be worn indoors. The weakness of the product is durability. The rubber underneath and the spiral metal will break with time.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Good but dont be too rough with them
customer_reviews.text: These work as advertised but I wouldnt use them on anything other than urban walking, that is, flat surfaces. I had two of these and one I mostly used in town and the others I used for trail walking. I am still using the in-town ones but the trail walking ones broke after just a few weeks of weekend walks; if you are going to do any "rough" walking I'd spend the extra money and get something more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Micheal S.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic for walking on Minnesota frozen lakes
customer_reviews.text: We walk every evening on the frozen lake with our dog. These are fantastic to prevent slipping. I have sorel boots size 6.5 and the small fit very easily on my boot. We often get thaws and then refreezes and the "roads" on the lake get very slippery. I feel very secure walking and now never slip. I check them every time I go out but when going in deep snow it did come off once but I found it the next day. If I loose one I will buy the version with the velcro
customer_reviews.author: skihut

customer_reviews.title: Broken within a month
customer_reviews.text: These worked great for about a month. They were very comfortable and really helped with traction on snow and ice. However, the rubber has broken in 2 places already and the metal has broken in 2 other places. I bought these just for my husband to walk the dog with, they maybe go about 1 mile per day, about 5-6 days per week in the winter. So with less than 25 miles on them, they are already trash. I would have expected to get at least one season out of them...not just a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: MNmarathoner13

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Terrible quality...I wore my Yaktrax for two days and the front rubber broke already....These must be cheap copies of the real Yaktrax that I have had every winter without a problem. Unfortunately I bought them in October and did not wear them until this week (December) so there is no return option. In the garbage they went.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Worked for hikes in Banff.
customer_reviews.text: These worked perfectly for the intended purpose. My husband and son thought I was wasting money buying these, but then were very happy they had them for spring hikes in the Canadian Rockies. There was still a good bit of packed snow on the trails at higher elevations and we needed them. I had true spikes, but the regular Yaktrax for walking seemed to work just as well for them...they got up and down with no incidents.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Babiarz

customer_reviews.title: great until it breaks
customer_reviews.text: My wife wore them about 6 times and they worked great until the rubber snapped, and now it won't stay on her shoe. I was really hoping to get at least a full winters use out of them. I bought the spiked version and they seem to be doing ok, really disappointed on this version. Sadly we were about to buy a couple pairs for her parents (in their 80's) but not worth the money. (edit) I just realized it is in the return period, so they will be sending a new pair. I will adjust rating if they work as designed and don't break this time
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great product with one major flaw
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product that does exactly what it is advertised to do with one major flaw: they will fall off your shoe without you noticing anytime you climb over a rock. Both my son and I lost one on our very first day of using them, causing us to go down the mountain with less traction that we hoped. I recommend paying up for the pro version that has the security strap on them.
customer_reviews.author: VK

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone downhill
customer_reviews.text: I've bought Yaktrax before ... twice ... this was my third purchase. I know that they don't last forever; however, prior to this pair, I've gotten 2 winter seasons out of one pair, if not more. I've had these for about a month, used 2-3 times per week and both of them have snapped a section of rubber. I'll use them until they are unusable, but in the meantime I'm going to investigate other brands now.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I've never used any sort of cleats before, but for a first impression, I'm very satisfied. These are stretched over your footwear with an elastic-fit. The metal spring-like treads work fantastic on the icy areas I've used them on - specifically a hill on my property that is often coated with sheer ice in the Winters here in New England. My dogs and their fancy dog claws no longer leave me behind in the distance. I swear they laugh at me. Oh, and the price is right. Be careful walking on tiles. Very. Slippery.
customer_reviews.author: Evilfiend

customer_reviews.title: Really help in icy conditions.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for hiking the Grand Canyon this last January. The paths at the higher, shaded elevations were coated in snow and ice. These were a life saver while carrying a large pack with a drop off a few feet away. The caveat is I don't believe these will last in an everyday application. I'm not impressed with the way the rubber goes under your boot.
customer_reviews.author: Corkscrew

customer_reviews.title: Great traction, gave me confidence on snow and ice
customer_reviews.text: I used these last night for the first time, when using my snowblower with 1 foot of snow and an icy driveway underneath. I was really surprised and grateful with the grip they provided. Our driveway has a 50 foot long 20 degree slope at the end which gets very icy, and it's always worrisome if I'll have safe footing on it. These cleats helped a lot on that slope. Because I've only used them once I can't comment on how well they'll last over time. But based on my one experience, I'd certainly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Maggie

customer_reviews.title: Just in my third season of using these -- and ...
customer_reviews.text: Just in my third season of using these -- and I don't use them all that hard (just to walk a mile to work when it is snowy or icy, probably 10-15 times a season) -- and they are already falling apart. A bit of the metal wire is bending out, which makes it catch on things sometimes when I walk. One of the rubber connections just snapped when I was putting them on. So now I need to get new traction cleats. I'll be trying some other brand.
customer_reviews.author: ch

customer_reviews.title: Do not stay on well, despite snugness
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a size small for a trip up a snowy mountain trail with a pair of waterproof Merrell hiking boots. The boots are a size 9 woman's. These cleats repeatedly slipped off and I was lucky enough to have seen it or had it found by a fellow hiker not far behind us. Eventually I lost one and didn't notice, it's still up there in the snow. My husband had the same slipping issues with his medium cleats on a men's 10.5 hiking boot but was lucky enough to end the day with a set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: worked great for short trip to glacier
customer_reviews.text: We took these on a trip to Alaska as we planned to visit a couple of glaciers and wanted something light weight to conserve on luggage weight. Everyone was surprised at how well they worked, no slipping or sliding... I forgot to take my boots with us and ended up wearing them over my Teva sandals with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ed in Albuquerque

customer_reviews.title: I never leave home without them...
customer_reviews.text: in the winter of course. I live in a town where no one gives a damn about people who commute or like to walk. I'm lucky enough to live close to work so I bought these after a nasty fall and a bruised hip. I can run for the bus too !!! Anyway, definitely get them. If you live in places like North Dakota and Michigan where water freezes in the air, you need these more than I do!!
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Last year's polar vortex and ice made me glad I had these
customer_reviews.text: Last year's TERRIBLE winter made me dig out my original pair after 18 years of storage! They make safe travel in horrible conditions easy and safe. I like them so well I bought a pair for my husband, and elderly friend, and a back up pair for me. These are the best ones I have ever used. Made choring in the ice as a fed my livestock safe, and kept me on my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Susan Trudell

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: I've worn these about a dozen times this winter. They work really well on ice, are easy to get on and off, and you can leave them on when driving. If I was going to spend a lot of time on ice, I would probably buy a "spiked" type of walking cleat, but for ventures on sidewalks and driveways, these are more than adequate.
customer_reviews.author: Walt Ginsberg

customer_reviews.title: Good, simple, solution to Icy  walks and aged body  resoponses!
customer_reviews.text: I carry these in my backpack for needed use if the weather gives me a frozen walking experience. At 71 years here I am happy to be "upright, vertical & ventilating" and able to walk all over town for my needs and pleasures & am not taking any chances at a quick, unwanted merging with the Earth 'cause as we all know, Gravity is still the Law! These help my traction and my peace of mind! Keepin' my Bones whole!!!
customer_reviews.author: MITCHELL MENDYS

customer_reviews.title: Yaktrax Traction Devices saved me from landing on my face a few times this past winter!
customer_reviews.text: Yaktrax Traction Devices saved me from landing on my face a few times this past winter! This particular model is safe to wear on carpet, or hardwood floors, but I would wear them inside for just a limited period of time because they can slip. On ice, they are fabulous! My only complaint is that the side straps look like they seem to be the weakest link in the construction, and I have to really stretch the side straps to get them on my boots. Time will tell! I love how they fold up for storage.
customer_reviews.author: Valleri

customer_reviews.title: These really work !
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my husband but I have also used them. His shoe size 13 , mine 8.5. but they work fine on my tennis shoes for just around the yard. Probably would come off in deep snow or rugged climbing. However they fit his shoe perfectly and he loves them. We live in the country in the midwest and it has been very icy in the yards with the thaw/freeze weather we have had. I had to take care of some neighbors animal chores and using these gave me great traction. I'm in my mid 60's and falling isn't an option if I can avoid it. I will be purchasing a pair in my own size.
customer_reviews.author: sralma

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Product!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these traction cleats a few days after slipping and falling on the ice in front of my house. After I received them and putting them on my shoes, I walked out the same door where I'd fallen and was amazed by the way they grip ice and packed snow. I won't know for a while how durable they'll be, but for now, I'm an extremely happy customer!!!
customer_reviews.author: A. G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Rubber breaks in the cold
customer_reviews.text: The elastic rubber broke after a weeks use. While walking on ice I noticed one of the metal coils was sticking out from the sole of one shoe. After returning to my garage I examined it and saw that a piece of the rubber webbing had snapped off and was flopping loose with the coil still attached to one end.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Stable and secure
customer_reviews.text: I walk to and from work on a daily basis. Sleet, snow, and ice make for treacherous travel. I used to worry about a slip and fall incident, but not now! These are fantastic! They grip beautifully in snow and sleet, and even ice wasn't any trouble for them! They're not sharp to touch, but the coils dig into the walking surface and provide the perfect amount of stability. I can walk assured now! The rubber part stretches easily to go over the shoe, then springs snugly into place to hold them firmly on my shoes. No damage to my shoe, either. These are fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Brosemer

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: I did not like the fact that I only had 6 weeks of using this product and it fell apart. In fact, during my snowblowing the 3rd week of February, which was only 6 weeks from the time I purchased this product, one of them fell off from my boot and must have been covered by all of the snow. The wire breaks and starts to fall apart right away. One week after I started to use them, the wire broke and when I stepped on my rug by the door, it hooked into the rug and I was walking with a rug stuck to my foot. A total waste of money, regardless of the price. Poor quality.
customer_reviews.author: Tuffy's

customer_reviews.title: Just right
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for two seasons now and they are an excellent compromise of light weight, flexibility, low cost, and effective traction. They are easy to put on and take off nearly any size or type of footwear, can be folded and put in a normal jacket pocket, last longer than other types I have tried, and work very well on smooth or rough ice.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fahle

customer_reviews.title: NOT GOOD FOR ICE
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money. Only good for powdery snow. Both my husband and I got a pair. Used them once, wasn't safe, Slipped on ice, took them off and haven't used since. Have owned them for several years. Will probably end up in trash, wouldn't want to give to charity and hear that someone used them and broke their neck slipping and falling on ice.
customer_reviews.author: LindaLouWho

customer_reviews.title: Must have in winter
customer_reviews.text: I slipped and dislocated my ankle in 2019. I've been wary of walking outside in the winter ever since. I purchased these and immediately noticed a huge difference. Ice/snow/slush, you name it, these give great traction. The only surface I've found so far that they aren't great with is a polished concrete floor, which is hardly a problem. If you walk in icy conditions - these will help.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stoner

customer_reviews.title: Buy Now!
customer_reviews.text: The BEST! If you're like me (afraid of falling on ice and snow), then these little easy-to-use devices will give you a new confidence. Used them over my Asics (tennis shoes) to walk safely and confidently on packed snow and ice. Do take them off if you are going indoors as they can be very slippery on tile. Wish I'd had these years ago! Oh - and based on some of the reviews, I actually bought a size larger than recommended on the packaging so I wouldn't have to work so hard stretching them out to put on. They worked great!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Traveled to Norway in January just after I received these. Snowed the whole time I was there. Wore them walking around the streets including climbing ice and snow covered stairs and platforms at outdoor train stations. These things really grip and they don't come off. Quite amazing really. I won't travel without them in the future. I was able to stretch these over my shoes while leaning against the wall when exiting a building - it was not necessary to sit down despite the limited motion in my knee from high school basketball. And they fold to fit into a normal winter coat pocket. I'm ordering a set for my wife.
customer_reviews.author: Kid's Books

customer_reviews.title: These things make me feel like Spiderman! Wore one on one shoe for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Glare ice with water in the parking lots today- with small patches of dry pavement on hills. These things make me feel like Spiderman! Wore one on one shoe for the first grocery run, (too slick to drive safely) both on the second trip. A simple, truly awesome way to NOT fall! Not great on tile floors, but easy to put on or remove. Awesome Product! I am ordering 2 more pairs for my senior friends- Taylor
customer_reviews.author: J. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Backup option for uncleared sidewalks
customer_reviews.text: Tried these as alternative to full overshoes in less snowy situations. Seem best suited for outdoor activities mostly on ice or packed snow, but per the instructions they aren’t suitable for cleared pavement. Therefore, not for full time wear on an urban commute, since they make concrete tile/wood floors extra slippery; light enough to carry as a backup option for uncleared sidewalks.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. V

customer_reviews.title: Feel more confident
customer_reviews.text: I live in MN and walk my dog most mornings, even in the winter. Took her out a couple of weeks ago and the path we use was completely iced covered due to a couple of warm days leading to snow melt. Uncomfortable and anxious walk. Bought these cleats a couple days later and have used them 3 times since. Feel much more confident walking on that path now. We'll see how they hold up but I have been happy so far. Easy to put on and take off. Should have gotten them a while ago.
customer_reviews.author: larrymicke

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product for snow and ice!
customer_reviews.text: We live in the northeast with lots of snow and ice in the winter. These work great - I even drive with them on to work, as the parking lot is not always plowed as it should be. These are not good on tile floors! My only issue is when it’s a packed snow, it sticks and builds up on the bottom and can make it hard to walk. A snow brush can remove the extra snow!
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: Story time: Went running after a snowfall, ended ...
customer_reviews.text: Story time: Went running after a snowfall, ended up slipping on ice that was covered by a light layer of snow. broke my nose and got a concussion. After that I was hesitant to run outside during the winter w/ my dogs. Got these and I've never been more stable and steady. Ended up getting my husband a pair since he was complaining of almost slipping on ice at least once a week during the winter.
customer_reviews.author: Lizski

customer_reviews.title: For me, good for 1 week
customer_reviews.text: Works great for about a week then the springy steel gets deformed and hooks on everything causing them to come off while out on the trails in ice and snow. If you're not paying attention you can easily loose one. And then what? Order another set so that you have a spare the following week for the same reason? There are other products out there that don't cost much more and hold up much much better.
customer_reviews.author: Woody

customer_reviews.title: Good traction on snow when ice
customer_reviews.text: I am a senior set a sin and I use these on my sneakers when I’m in the snow on the ice and they work really well they’re easy to put on my sneakers also and very easy to takeoff also. My house is carpeted so I walk around on the carpet and it doesn’t seem to hurt the carpet. You got to be careful walking on hardwood floors are tile because they can be a little slippery. I would recommend H to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: James K.

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER ONCE GOOD PRODUCT GONE BAD!
customer_reviews.text: I bought my first pair of these 10 years ago and they finally broke last winter. This pair lasted a total of 3 minutes before one of them broke. Walked on ice 10 feet to the garage and 10 feet back to the house and it broke just before I got to the door. This now a horrible product that I will never waste my money on again! BUYER BEWARE!
customer_reviews.author: rorinsmith

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and design
customer_reviews.text: I was attracted by this product due to its lightweight and lower price. I was WRONG. My first pair failed after my first hike: the rubber part at the bottom broke (see photo). After I contacted the seller, I was provided another pair. Well, it lasted longer but now very long. After a few hikes, it failed too. After a few times, the metal spring became thinner and thus provide less traction. For $10 more, you can get a much sturdy product with a much stronger design and higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: T. You

customer_reviews.title: You can dance on ice, feels safe and secure walking in bad weather.
customer_reviews.text: You can dance on ice, feels safe and secure walking in bad weather. Just be careful on stone like granet or slate it feels icy. My earlier pairs came with a waterproof bag to throw them in your packet easily, these did not. I purchased a small zipper bag to use. They are very easy to put on and can remove fast with one hand.
customer_reviews.author: mjsgadget

customer_reviews.title: great for icy weather
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 73 year old mother because she'd lost one of her original pair of Yaktrax. She loves these for ease of use, storage and safety. If you live in a place where it gets icy during the winter and you have a tendency to fall, these work very well to stabilize any type of shoe and make getting around a whole lot safer!
customer_reviews.author: Janette Wilkes

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: My husband is police officer and their boots doesn't help much for traction in the snow or ice when he's having to work wrecks so we got these. They done GREAT! We've had to purchase more for his co workers when they seen how great they worked. Definitely worth the money if you're in law enforcement, wrecker service, etc..
customer_reviews.author: Kandi

customer_reviews.title: Up to a MN winter and all the snow and ice
customer_reviews.text: It is so wonderful that they are easy enough for my 87 year old dad to get on and off his tennis shoes easy, and he walks 1-3 miles a day outside even in winter. Seems as though these are the fall proof insurance and makes it very safe for him to be outside in the winter conditions. LOVE THESE!! Bought a 2nd pair so he can keep them in the car in case he has to walk a long ways in a parking lot or something...
customer_reviews.author: YsLadyMN

customer_reviews.title: Life savers!
customer_reviews.text: These ice grips are terrific! Easy on and off and ideal for walking the dog in yard or on the road when it's snowy and icy as it has been this entire winter ( 2019). I am convinced they saved me from hitting the ground more than once! You can also walk across the carpet or flooring in the house when you have to grab that something you forgot after slipping them over your boots. Just hoping I don't have to wear them much longer but here in New England, even in April, ya never know!
customer_reviews.author: Janet P. OKeefe

customer_reviews.title: Keeps me from falling in snow and ice.
customer_reviews.text: These worked better than I expected. We don't get a lot of snow in south Seattle or Auburn but when we do I use these to walk across the parking lot or to get the mail at the end of the road. I live where the shade can keep the sun from melting and the snow will turn icy and these keep me from slipping and falling. However, do NOT use indoors. They can be very slick on some flooring, which I found out by wearing them inside the restaurant. Great for getting across snowy or icy parking lots!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, easy to put on, and they grrrrrip the ice
customer_reviews.text: These little guys have come in handy over the winter when streets are icy. I like that they are light and easy to stuff in a coat pocket when you get on the bus or reach another destination. But they do grip on slick, smooth ice, giving you great stability when walking. There's not much to them, so they simply roll up until you need 'em. Then, just unroll them and slip them over your shoes. What could be better?
customer_reviews.author: R. Klein

customer_reviews.title: ... bought a pair of yaktrax in 2014 that were excellent. I decided I wanted a couple of back ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of yaktrax in 2014 that were excellent. I decided I wanted a couple of back up pairs as I walk everyday regardless of conditions. The two sets of yaktrax that I received both broke on the first walk in which I used them so I am back to using my 2014 yaktrax. It is a good product but perhaps they changed manufacturers and now the quality is subpar. If it simply happened on one pair I would chalk it up to unlucky but for it to happen on both pairs strikes me as a quality trend. I will probably go with a different brand going forward.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great traction on ice and snow!
customer_reviews.text: This past winter was bad for us in Kansas City. We’ve been spoiled for about three years with mild winters and these came in handy. I deliver packages for Amazon Flex and I had very few issues getting around. Make sure they are fitted to your shoe squarely and they will never come off and last a good while.
customer_reviews.author: finalout99

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Ordinarily, I am a lover of Yaktrax! Living in Maine, I rely on their cleats during the winter to save my clumsy self from falling all the time. Unfortunately, I purchaced a new pair last month, and exactly 31 days from purchase, the rubber on one cleat snapped, rendering it useless. Upon a closer look, the rubber on both cleats have tears and are about to fall apart. Very disappointed, and am now on the search for a new pair. I don't expect them to last forever, but more than a month surely!
customer_reviews.author: K.B.

customer_reviews.title: Won't stay on. Keeps popping off.
customer_reviews.text: Just needed to walk to car, etc. First 4 times I used them, 3 times they fell off. They are very light weight. Too flimsy for me. I used them over boots. Size / tension seemed good. But they just come off way to easy. I was lucky to find them after they fell off. I would not recommend these for any use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could get them to last more than one season.
customer_reviews.text: I purchase a pair of these annually. They work great. Hi leave them on my boots all season because they fit really snugly. Because of arthritis in my hands getting them on my boots is a challenge to stretch them in place. If I removed them daily I think they would probably last longer. For the price and security it's worth knowing I can walk the dog without wiping out.
customer_reviews.author: V. Chaplin

customer_reviews.title: Boost confidence walking in wintery conditions
customer_reviews.text: Didn't get to use a lot this year, but when I did they were fabulous and helped me feel more secure. Did not slip on ice, but they warn it's not full proof and I can attest to that just from testing it out. Highly recommend for all who feel unstable and for the elderly or anyone wanting more confidence in wintery conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Avagarland

customer_reviews.title: Don't Ice Fish without them
customer_reviews.text: After making the poor decision of walking on a frozen lake without these and then Charlie Browning it flat on my back I decided to put them on. My fishing trip would have probably been less painful if I had put them on sooner. Once they were on I had great grip and they stayed on my boots without slipping off or being annoying. They are lite and give great traction. Don't go ice fishing without some kind of cleats, you will regret it sooner or later.
customer_reviews.author: N. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Not for clear, dry surfaces--only for ice and snow!
customer_reviews.text: While I liked the grip they give on all kinds of snow and ice (except for glare ice), I found they didn't hold up at all on clear, dry surfaces. Two of the rubber elements snapped after a month, and spiral wire broke in two places. Don't think quality of material is good at all--won't buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Peter L. Coleman

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely terrific. They easily slip on shoes and boots. I walk very active large shelter dogs on a steeply-hilled 1/3 mile wooded trail. During this 2019 Missouri winter, the Yaktrax allowed me to walk safely on pure ice, hard-packed snow, slush/ice mix, ane even a mud-ice mix downhill and uphill. Without them I could not walk even a few steps on those surfaces. They are invaluable. I will definitely buy them again if this pair ever wears out.
customer_reviews.author: DennisWT

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than an emergency room visit.  But QC issues, somewhere along the line.
customer_reviews.text: On one of the pair, just one of the rubber strips attaching the 'chain' part to the heel tab has a twist in it. (Also: it arrived in a package that says Prime all over it, although I use free shipping and do not have Amazon Prime.) Still, these YakTrax are good cheap health insurance, if you ever walk on snowy or icy surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: A. New

customer_reviews.title: If you Run, you need This!
customer_reviews.text: If you are a runner and hate running on the treadmill, I highly recommend this product. I ran in slick, crushed down snow and these worked perfectly. This product will affect your pace, gait and stride, but it is much better than running on a treadmill. I have recommended this product to all of my running friends!
customer_reviews.author: B Wkmn

customer_reviews.title: Yaktrax really work!
customer_reviews.text: Just tried these today and work great. Especially on the icy patches so prevalent this time of year. Purchased size to primarily fit on hiking boots which are larger than every day shoes. But even though tiny bit larger on walking shoes, traction still excellent. Really happy to have a pair of these to help facilitate safer walking outdoors in these Wisconsin winters.
customer_reviews.author: Grandma J.

customer_reviews.title: Mine have stayed together
customer_reviews.text: I see a lot of people saying they have had problems with these falling apart but ours have been fine. We are careful to only wear them when we actually need them and avoid wearing them on hard surfaces that aren't snowy or icy. I'd say they've survived 20+ miles without incident. Perhaps they have different vendors. in any case, they have definitely saved me from a few falls.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Gallant

customer_reviews.title: Confidence inspiring in slippery conditions
customer_reviews.text: Last winter I slipped on an icy spot in my parking lot and broke my ankle. It was about a 6 month process which included surgery and physical therapy. I never want to go through that again. So I purchased these to help me have better traction on the slippery stuff and hopefully prevent another injury. I've only had the chance to wear them a little bit, but they're comfortable, slipped onto my boots easily, and I felt more confident in slippery situations.
customer_reviews.author: Sparty76BC

customer_reviews.title: Keeping my rotator cuff in tact!
customer_reviews.text: Having fallen on a slippery driveway last winder and tearing my rotator cuff because of the fall, I needed something more stable than boots for my winter shoveling duties. A friend recommended I look into 'ice shoes' and of course I jumped on Amazon. Fast forward 10 months and post surgery and physical therapy; I bought 'em and already used them this year and with confidence, was able to 'get back on that bike!'
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Finn

product_meta.title: Yaktrax Walk Traction Cleats for Walking on Snow and Ice (1 Pair)
product_meta.description: Yaktrax Walk Traction Cleats are lightweight, affordable, and easy to put on and take off, making them a simple solution for reducing the risk of falls when walking on snow and ice to work, school, or even to the mailbox. A highly elastic outer band and a tab on the heel help the cleats slip easily on and off of shoes, making Walk Traction Cleats perfect for pedestrians, professionals and the elderly. Traction is provided by abrasion-resistant 1.2 mm steel coils that are coated with zinc to help prevent rust. The shaped edge of the coils provide 360 degrees of traction on cold surfaces for all-direction stability. Yaktrax Walk Traction Cleats are tested safe from breakage in temperatures as low as -41 degrees F. They are available in four sizes to fit most shoes: Extra-small for petite sizes (fits shoe size W2.5-6/M1-4.5); Small (fits shoe size W6.5-10, M5-8.5); Medium (fits shoe size W10.5-12.5, M9-11); Large (fits shoe size W13-15, M11.5-13.5). For oversized shoes or boots, Yaktrax recommends purchasing one size larger than your normal shoe size.
feature_bullets: Lightweight and affordable slip on traction cleats to reduce the risk of falls when walking on snow or ice to work, school, or even to the mailbox
Made of abrasion resistant 1.2 millimeter steel coils with zinc coating to prevent rust: secured to shoes with durable Polyelastomer outer band
Provides 360 degrees of traction on cold surfaces for all direction stability
Highly elastic outer band with heel tab slips easily slips on and off of shoes; perfect for pedestrians, professionals and the elderly
Available in XS (Extra small) S, M, and L sizes to fit most shoes

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
